answer: Yes. You can make an appointment at your local public health unit to have your child immunized.  A public health nurse can recommend and provide your child's vaccines and answer any questions you may have.  You can find the contact information for your local public health unit here: http://immunizebc.ca/finder.
question: I did not immunize my child as an infant. She is now six and I have changed my stance. Can she be immunized now?
question_variation_0: can a child be immunized now
question_variation_1: can six year olds be immunized
question_variation_2: can a child be immunized now
